result.execSummary:
The defendant Jefferson Allen Grooms Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Registry Violation, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(6)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With credit for 3  days; TIME SERVED.

-  Court sets Restitution at $0 (zero).
-  Court waives non-mandatory costs, fees, assessments and surcharges due to defendant's financial obligations.
-  Defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis and pay any mandatory costs, fees, assessments or surcharges (if not already done so) by September 22, 2023.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jefferson Allen Grooms Jr

records.addlTxt: Filed: Original Transcript of Preliminary Hearing ( 9 pages) commencing 07-19-2022 by Danielle N. Holcomb.

Court found the State has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant.

-  Court sets Restitution at $0  (zero)

Court sentenced defendant to serve   3  DAYS  in the House of Correction with credit for  3  days; TIME SERVED.  

-  Court waives non-mandatory costs, fees, assessments and surcharges due to defendant's financial obligations.

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis and pay any mandatory costs, fees, assessments or surcharges (if not already done so) by September 22, 2023.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Appeal rights given.  Pretrial Incarceration Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.

Defendant Jefferson Allen Grooms Jr in court.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court for Jefferson Allen Grooms Jr.  Attorney Erin Michelle Karshen in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties; waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of  GUILTY  and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint and orders a judgment of conviction be entered.

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms; further, defendant is advised he cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  Defendant was further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. 

Parties are prepared to proceed to sentencing.

Clerk:  jms
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Jefferson Allen Grooms Jr in court.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court for Jefferson Allen Grooms Jr.  Attorney Erin Michelle Karshen in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defense counsel advises Court that defendant is now compliant with the registry and requests adjournment for plea and sentencing.
Court orders case adjourned for plea and sentencing in Branch 28.

Clerk:  jms

Defendant Jefferson Allen Grooms in court with Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Wisconsin Sex Offender Registry Specialist S. Baumann. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 28.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.

Defendant Jefferson Allen Grooms in court with attorney Michael V Fuentes.  Defendant Jefferson Allen Grooms in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jefferson Allen Grooms appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. 

This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/
   99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  

Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
